intro: Ouratea platicaulis, commonly known as the flat-stemmed ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often ribbed stems and simple, opposite leaves. It produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that are typically borne on inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
